Package etithespirit.orimod.energy

Class FluxBehavior

java.lang.Object
etithespirit.orimod.api.energy.FluxBehavior
public final class FluxBehavior extends Object
Represents "flux behavior" in Light equipment. This behavior causes random energy storage deviations (such as randomly adding or removing an arbitrary amount of energy). The exact manner in which this occurs and in what amount is determined by an instance of this class.

A crude analogy is to call this "a means of applying entropy".

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final FluxBehavior
    DISABLED
    A FluxBehavior that representing no entropy whatsoever, that is, the storage container this applies to is 100% stable.
    final boolean
    isDisabledFlux
    Whether or not this FluxBehavior has no behavior.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FluxBehavior(NumberRange magnitude)
    Create a new flux behavior using the given NumberRange as its room for error, and a bias of 0.
    FluxBehavior(NumberRange magnitude, double bias)
    Create a new flux behavior using the given NumberRange as is room for error, with the given bias, which is always added to the return value of this flux (see getNextEnvFlux(boolean, boolean, boolean).

  • Field Details

    • DISABLED

      public static final FluxBehavior DISABLED
      A FluxBehavior that representing no entropy whatsoever, that is, the storage container this applies to is 100% stable.

    • isDisabledFlux

      public final boolean isDisabledFlux
      Whether or not this FluxBehavior has no behavior. This is only true on DISABLED.

  • Constructor Details

    • FluxBehavior

      public FluxBehavior(NumberRange magnitude)
      Create a new flux behavior using the given NumberRange as its room for error, and a bias of 0.
      Parameters:
      magnitude - A NumberRange representing the lowest and highest bounds of randomization to add to a value.

    • FluxBehavior

      public FluxBehavior(NumberRange magnitude, double bias)
      Create a new flux behavior using the given NumberRange as is room for error, with the given bias, which is always added to the return value of this flux (see getNextEnvFlux(boolean, boolean, boolean).
      Parameters:
      magnitude - A NumberRange representing the lowest and highest bounds of randomization to add to a value.
      bias - A constant value that is added to the return values generated by this flux.

  • Method Details

    • getNextEnvFlux

      public double getNextEnvFlux(boolean canExtract, boolean canReceive, boolean simulate)
      Returns the next amount of flux. canExtract and canReceive should reflect the ILightEnergyStorage this exists for, and will set the min (or max) of the randomized energy modifier to 0 accordingly as to not cause unwanted changes. This will always return 0 on DISABLED.
      Parameters:
      canExtract - Whether or not the element can extract energy.
      canReceive - Whether or not the element can receive energy.
      simulate - Whether or not this fluctuation is simulated.
      Returns:
      The net energy, which may be positive or negative depending on the circumstances.

    • getRange

      public NumberRange getRange()
      Returns the NumberRange that is used to generate values. If the flux was constructed with a MutableNumberRange, then it is also possible to use this return value to change the applicable range. This will always return NumberRange.ZERO on DISABLED.
      Returns:
      The range used to generate random values.

    • getBias

      public double getBias()
      Returns the bias of this behavior. This will always return 0 on DISABLED.
      Returns:
      A constant bias always added to the value.

    • setBias

      public void setBias(double newBias)
      Sets the bias of this behavior. This will always do nothing on DISABLED.
      Parameters:
      newBias - A new bias to constantly add to this value.

    • isEnabled

      public boolean isEnabled()
      Returns:
      Whether or not this FluxBehavior is allowed to alter the storage it is tied to. This will always return false on DISABLED.

    • setEnabled

      public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets whether or not this FluxBehavior is allowed to alter the storage it is tied to. This will always do nothing on DISABLED.
      Parameters:
      enabled - Whether or not this can alter the storage it's tied to.
